nodes.text: The MB-7 range finder produced by TaggeCo was a type of rangefinder incorporated with a computer and visual sensors, which were designed to assist in calculating the distance to any spot in a user's vision, providing precise information to a visor HUD. With the information, the wearer could push their weapon to its limits while knowing when to hold their fire on impossible shots. The MB-7 costed 1,500 credits.
